name: Scrambled Peppers and Eggs
description: As in many Mark Bittman recipes, the idea here is more vegetables --  in this case, peppers -- than protein. It works because except for the jalapeño, none of the peppers is hot.
recipeIngredient: 1 fresh hot green chile (like jalapeño), chopped, optional

recipeInstructions.text: Put oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until it’s translucent, 1 or 2 minutes.
Add peppers, chiles and garlic, and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Cook, stirring occasionally, until peppers are brightly colored but not too soft, 4 to 6 minutes.

Reduce heat to medium-low and pour in eggs. Cook, stirring occasionally with a wooden spoon or rubber spatula, until eggs are cooked, 3 to 8 minutes. Serve on toast or over rice, or wrapped in a flour tortilla.
